text: This is pretty interesting, about the Swedish response: <https://foreignpolicy.com/2020/12/22/sweden-coronavirus-covid-response/|https://foreignpolicy.com/2020/12/22/sweden-coronavirus-covid-response/>

attachments.title: The Inside Story of How Sweden Botched Its Coronavirus Response
attachments.text: Stockholm denies pursuing herd immunity. But internal emails show Swedish officials were resigned to mass infections all along.
attachments.fallback: Foreign Policy: The Inside Story of How Sweden Botched Its Coronavirus Response

elements.text: This is pretty interesting, about the Swedish response:

text:
The government is only pretending to do nothing. They want the old folks to die off so that the pension system will survive. The social democrats polled at the highest levels since 2014 thanks to their response as people were thrilled to have more money in their pockets. Or something...

Maybe herd immunity was the only viable response (the government does not yet have the have authority to impose a lockdown; they might get it from the parliament in January)
